participant_id.Description: Unique BIDS identifier for the participant in this study.

subjectkey.Description: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject

src_subject_id.Description: Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project

interview_date.Description: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY

interview_age.Description: Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging. | Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

sex.Description: Sex of subject at birth | M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

eventname.Description: The event name for which the data was collected

fit_ss_sleepdate.Description: Date of the night (PM portion of sleep period) of sleep being considered

fit_ss_wkno.Description: Week number since start of protocol | Only first 3 weeks will be included in weekly aggregation (protocol length of wear)

fit_ss_weekend_ind.Description: Is this day a weekend (Saturday or Sunday) | 0=no; 1=yes

fit_ss_protocol_date.Description: First day of (expected) wear by 3 week protocol

fit_ss_protocol_wear.Description: Is this day during the 3 week protocol period? | 0=no; 1=yes

fit_ss_first_inbed_minutes.Description: First Minute that the participant was identified as being in-bed (but not necessarily asleep) | All data is offset by 12 hours so that 00:00= noon;  23:59=11:59A

fit_ss_first_sleep_minutes.Description: First Minute that the participant was identified as being asleep | All data is offset by 12 hours so that 00:00= noon;  23:59=11:59A

fit_ss_outbed_minutes.Description: First Minute that the participant was identified as being out-bed (but may have woken up prior to this) | All data is offset by 12 hours so that 00:00= noon;  23:59=11:59A

fit_ss_wakeup_minutes.Description: First Minute that the participant was identified as being awake | All data is offset by 12 hours so that 00:00= noon;  23:59=11:59A

fit_ss_total_sleep_minutes.Description: Total time within the sleep window (including wake periods) as calculated by 30 second sleep record

fit_ss_sleepperiod_minutes.Description: Total time in sleep (light plus deep plusREM)

fit_ss_wake_minutes.Description: Total number of Minutes (in 30 second increments) identified as being awake during the sleep window | Does not include any Minutes anotated as awake prior to the first Minute of sleep (i.e. does not count latency)

fit_ss_light_minutes.Description: Total number of Minutes (in 30 second increments) identified as being in "light" sleep stage during the sleep window

fit_ss_deep_minutes.Description: Total number of Minutes (in 30 second increments) identified as being in "deep" sleep stage during the sleep window

fit_ss_rem_minutes.Description: Total number of Minutes (in 30 second increments) identified as being in "REM" sleep stage during the sleep window

fit_ss_wake_count.Description: Total number of unique awakenings during the sleep period (excludes final awakening)

fit_ss_avg_hr_wake.Description: Average heart rate during Minutes that were classified as awake | In the event that the two (2) 30-second epochs within the Minute under review did not agree regarding sleep stage the HR for that Minute was not included.

fit_ss_avg_hr_light.Description: Average heart rate during Minutes that were classified as light sleep stage | In the event that the two (2) 30-second epochs within the Minute under review did not agree regarding sleep stage the HR for that Minute was not included.

fit_ss_avg_hr_deep.Description: Average heart rate during Minutes that were classified as deep sleep stage | In the event that the two (2) 30-second epochs within the Minute under review did not agree regarding sleep stage the HR for that Minute was not included.

fit_ss_avg_hr_rem.Description: Average heart rate during Minutes that were classified as REM sleep stage | In the event that the two (2) 30-second epochs within the Minute under review did not agree regarding sleep stage the HR for that Minute was not included.
